reviews.text: The BBQ chicken and beef skewers, fried salted egg French beans, mala grilled fish, and beef in radish are delicious! üòãüî•  High in salt and spice though, so eat in moderation!  üå∂Ô∏èüßÇ The ambience is a bit noisy during peak hours üó£Ô∏è but the food makes it worth it! #Food #Dinner #Restaurant #SpicyFood #BBQ #Mala #Delicious

L
I recently dined at A Kitchen and it was a delightful experience! The atmosphere was spacious and inviting, perfect for a relaxed meal. However, the loud karaoke was a bit distracting for my taste.

The service was a bit slow, likely because some waitresses were busy preparing food, but they were friendly and attentive when they could be.

Now, onto the food‚Äîeverything was freshly cooked and delicious! One of the standout dishes was the BBQ skewers; they were nicely spiced and incredibly affordable $1/stick. We also tried a few other dishes, which were slightly on the salty and oily side but paired well with rice.

Overall, the prices were reasonable, and I left satisfied. I would definitely visit again for the great food and ambiance (minus the karaoke)!

The bbq lamb and pork is spicy and shiok
Egg is tasty.
The fried rice and the dumplings are average.
Price is reasonable

Tried this franchise at Vision Exchange before. The food is average as compared to the other franchise. Visited this place on a Sunday for dinner, service was awful due to the crowd, understandable but it could be better. The restaurant is well decorated, which is a plus.

Would definitely recommend this place for gathering but it won‚Äôt be my top picks for sure.

Colleague recommended trying the place due to their affordable Chuan Chuan ($1), and I will say it did not disappoint! The chicken is really tender, and the beef also had a nice texture to it! Both were really well seasoned and tasty. Do note that there is a minimum order of 3 for each type.

The food can be a bit oily though. For example, the ‚Äúpotato in tin foil‚Äù is cooked completely in oil, but it was still a nice dish to try. The potato frels like it melts in your mouth, and explodes with the oily flavour. Which makes it pretty addictive to eat.

Restaurant is mostly self service. Orders are done by scanning a QR code, and even the drinks are self service.

Like most Chinese restaurants, do come here with a larger group of people. Most of the food comes in large sharing portions.
